alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 6:42PM MDT until April 17 at 4:54PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Jemez River Above Jemez Pueblo affecting Sandoval County. .Warm temperatures continue to cause rapid melting of snowpack, causing increased river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor to moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Jemez River above Jemez Pueblo. This especially includes areas between Jemez Springs and Jemez Pueblo. * WHEN...Until Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Broadcast media reported that the Jemez Wastewater Treatment Plant had been inundated with water with potential wastewater flowing into the river. Walking, fishing and drinking along the river is highly discouraged. At 8.0 feet, Significant overbank flows are occurring from above Jemez Springs down through the Jemez Pueblo. Further rises will result in bridges becoming unsafe to cross in and around Jemez Springs. At 10.0 feet, Widespread overbank flooding is occurring. Bridges in and around Jemez Springs are either impassable or unsafe to cross due to the high water and debris caught up in the fast flow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 7.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 9.4 feet Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 05/13/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Walking near riverbanks is highly discouraged. To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning around 900 AM MDT.
